results.title: Composition
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses composition as one of the basic elements of design and illustrates the function of good design, both in the world of art and in industry and everyday life

results.title: Eye on Research
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Patterns of heredity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Eye on Research”.
What happens to human cells in certain cases of blood cancer? Can mongolism be inherited? What makes us grow old? In this study of the research being made into heredity, questions such as these are considered.

results.title: Kidneys (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring the Body”.
Concise and detailed animation clearly defines the complex inner structures and functions of the Kidneys. Filmed segments emphasise the relationship of healthy kidneys to the well being of the body.

results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: Teeth
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring the body”
Illustrates the growth and care of teeth, from the formation of milk teeth to their replacement by permanent teeth. Describes the inner structure of teeth and the dental treatment of decay and application of braces to correct the position of the teeth.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: From my point of view
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Uses sequences showing children from the ages of two and a half to five and a half with an adult in order to analyse the ways in which a child’s egocentrism affects the ability to see another person’s point of view. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Painting time
results.creator_credit: David Vogt, John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Follows a young child totally absorbed in exploration of line, color and shape. Highlights gross motor skills and the concentration span of the four to five year old child. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.
